Key Arguments: The bill violates fundamental human rights, including freedom of speech and expression.
ACMA should not have unilateral authority over media channels, as it could lead to misuse and abuse of power.
The bill is seen as evidence of a totalitarian intent by the government to control information.
The bill could lead to censorship and erode public trust in authority.
The bill would impede the right to self-determination by restricting views and opinions on internet platforms.
Notable Quotes: This bill aims to restrict these fundamental rights and is therefore a violation of all Australianâ€™s fundamental rights.
Once these rights are lost, they will never be returned to us, the Australian people.
This bill is prone to misapplication by nefarious, negligent, or otherwise compromised members of ACMA and the government more generally.
Open exchange of opinion and ideas is vital to a democratic society, and such openness is vital to human rights protections.
I fundamentally and vehemently oppose this Bill.
